heading: What is the European Union's fish-catching record?
subheading: In 2024, EU catches were estimated at 1.9 million tonnes in live weight, confirming the downward trend recorded since 2018.
textNote: 2024 Data for Spain, Portugal and Italy are confidential. Fish catches cover fish, molluscs, crustaceans and other aquatic animals, residues and aquatic plants that are taken for all purposes, by all types and class of vessel, gear and fishermen, operated in all the seven marine areas legally covered by EU statistical regulations. They cover catches in high-sea fishing areas, offshore, inshore or brackish water areas. The production from aquaculture and catches in fresh water are excluded.
